content:
I am not sure what you are posting for! just click the close button. Or in all likely hood if it is still running after a crash you have not submitted your crash report so submitting that will generally offer a similar restart Thunderbird button.

Regardless the dialog is telling you the application is still running on your system and needs to be closed to start another session. It is also offering to do it for you.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: What error message do you see when you stop getting mail? Do you have an antivirus product blocking access. It sounds like a failure in antivirus scanning to just die after a number of days, but it could also be from you moving around on the internet via a VPN.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Никита Дроздов said
P.S. ImportExportTools NG "Automatic backup" is not automatic, you need to close Thunderbird manually every day for this to work.

Then I guess you are plumb out of luck as far as addons go.

Perhaps you need to look at a system backup utility, rather than just messing with your mail as a separate entity to be backed up. Perhaps something from this list https://www.tecmint.com/linux-system-backup-tools/
creator: MattAuSupport
